Course Description: THIS COURSE REVIEWS ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES AND THEN EXPANDS INTO THE SPECIALIZED TREATMENT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, CURRENT ASSETS, CURRENT LIABILITIES, LONG-TERM PLANT ASSETS AND TAX PROCEDURES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major: APPLY PROPER ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES TO BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS AND PREPARE APPROPRIATE JOURNAL ENTRIES 2. PREPARE INTERIM AND ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH GAAP 3. IDENTIFY AND APPLY THE APPROPRIATE TREATMENT AND RECORDING OF CASH AND TEMPORARY ASSETS 4. CALCULATE THE PROPER VALUE OF AND RECORD RECEIVABLES AND INVENTORIES, INCLUDING GENERAL AND ESTIMATING PROCEDURES 5. EXPLAIN THE PROPER ACCOUNTING FOR THE ACQUISITION, USE AND RETIREMENT OF LONG-TERM PLANT ASSETS 6. DETERMINE THE PROPER INCOME TAX PROCEDURES IN ACCOUNTING FOR SPECIFIC CIRCUMSTANCES.
Textbook(s):
INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING, 16TH EDITION. DONALD E. KIESO, JERRY J. WEYGANDT, TERRY D. WARFIELD. ISBN: 978-1-118-74291-6. MARCH 2016.
